Member Function Documentation

CDivider::STANDARD_CONSTRUCTORS ( CDivider ) [virtual]
 

Resize the children when the handles are moved (default)

Reimplemented from CGroup.

int CDivider::setResizeOff ( )
 

Don't resize the children, just invoke the callback

int CDivider::setResizeBothOn ( )
 

Resize both widgets: the one to the left and to the right (or above and below) the dragged handle.

int CDivider::setResizeBothOff ( )
 

Resize only the left (above) widget and move the right (below) widget

int CDivider::setInvisibleDrag ( )
 

int CDivider::setVisibleDrag ( )
 

If visible drag is set, photon displays the moving dividing line while dragging

int CDivider::setDividerOffset ( int dividerOffset )
 

This number is added to positions of child widgets (relative to the position of the PtDivider widget) when the values for the Pt_ARG_DIVIDER_SIZES resource are calculated. By setting the Pt_ARG_DIVIDER_OFFSET resource you can make the Pt_ARG_DIVIDER_SIZES resource relative to any arbitrary point.

PtDividerSizes_t * CDivider::getDividerSizes ( )
 

The array of positions and sizes of realized children of the divider. typedef struct Pt_divider_sizes {

void CDivider::addDragCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

Adds a callback that is invoked after each drag event received by the widget
